Week 7 Fun Fact A fun fact introduced by Dr.Â Soo during the departmental social event: Given that \(U_1, U_2, U_3...\) are independent and identically distributed where \(U_i \sim \text{unif}[0,1]\). Let \(T = \textbf{min}\{n \leq 1: U_1 + U_2 + ... + U_n > 1\}\), where \(n = 2, 3, 4..., etc\). The expected value of \(T\) approximately equals to \(e\), i.e., \(\mathbb{E}(T) \approx e\). We can prove this statement by running an R simulation: T <- function() { n = 0 t = 0 while (t < 1) { t <- t + runif(1) n <- n + 1 } n } Expected_Value = mean(replicate(100000, T())) ## E(T) = 2.71966
